definition: violent rain (e.g. due to monsoon or typhoon)/cloudburst
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: The heavy rains brought about a severe flood.
sentences.chinese: 一连串的豪雨导致了严重的水灾。

sentences.english: In late August, Typhoon Zita brought more heavy rain to Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 八月下旬，台风思蒂为本港带来更多的豪雨。

sentences.english: The river rises after heavy rains.
sentences.chinese: 几场豪雨之后，河水高涨。

sentences.english: Many pumping stations couldn't keep up with the heavy rainfall caused by typhoon Nari.
sentences.chinese: 抽水站无法及时应付纳莉台风所带来的豪雨。

sentences.english: Typhoon usually bring heavy rain and strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 台风通常带来豪雨和强风。

sentences.english: The road was washed out by the heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 那一条道路被豪雨冲损。

sentences.english: Days of torrential rain in Prachuap County, Thailand, caused severe flooding.
sentences.chinese: 泰国巴蜀县，连日豪雨淹水成灾。

sentences.english: The torrential rains in the month of April, give rise to the glorious flowers in the month of May.
sentences.chinese: 四月里的豪雨，会带来五月里的繁花似锦。

sentences.english: It stands to reason that you take the Bus in this heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 在豪雨天里你搭公车是顺理成章的事。

sentences.english: Heavy rains led to flooding in Kinshasa, Congo.
sentences.chinese: 豪雨导致刚果首都金夏沙泛滥成灾。

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
